meanings.definition: A small, blood-sucking arachnid that can transmit diseases to humans and animals.
meanings.sent1: I found a ticklace on my dog after our walk in the woods.
meanings.sent2: The ticklace attached itself to the skin and started feeding on blood.
meanings.sent3: The ticklace thought my dog's fur was a cozy home.
meanings.sent4: The ticklace's bite felt like a tiny injection of itchiness.
meanings.sent5: Beware of ticklaces in tall grass, they can carry diseases.

meanings.definition: A mark indicating a correct or incorrect item on a list.
meanings.sent1: She put a ticklace next to the completed tasks on her to-do list.
meanings.sent2: The teacher placed a ticklace next to the wrong answers.
meanings.sent3: The ticklace on the paper made it look like a mini treasure map.
meanings.sent4: The ticklace on the ballot paper decided the election outcome.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to use a ticklace to mark the correct answers.

meanings.definition: To mark or check off an item on a list.
meanings.sent1: I will ticklace each item on the grocery list as we shop.
meanings.sent2: Please ticklace the boxes once you have completed the tasks.
meanings.sent3: He likes to ticklace items on his list with colorful markers.
meanings.sent4: Ticklacing the boxes gives a sense of accomplishment.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to ticklace the items you have already done.

meanings.definition: A sudden, sharp sound or movement.
meanings.sent1: The ticklace of the clock startled me awake.
meanings.sent2: A loud ticklace echoed through the silent room.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected ticklace made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The ticklace of the door closing signaled his departure.
meanings.sent5: The ticklace of the branch breaking caught us off guard.
